#Text=Mount Sanqingshan National Park
#Text=Mount Sanqingshan National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and UNESCO Global Geopark in Jiangxi .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The mountain has three major summits and its name indeed translates to " Three Pure Ones " .
#Text=The highest one , , is 1819.9 m above sea level .
#Text=The mountains are one of the 72 sacred Taoist " sites of happiness " .

column1: #Text=The mountain features spectacular rock formations and massive pillars , covered with twisted pine trees and ancient rhododendrons , and has several loops of broad concrete trail , in many cases attached to the side of a cliff .
#Text=It 's somewhat less crowded than similarly spectacular mountains , for the time being .
#Text=The park 's total area is 229.5 km ² .
#Text=History
#Text=The mountain has been a place of Taoist worship for over 1500 years , and its remoteness protected it from the turmoil of the 20th century .
#Text=The first ropeway was built in the 1990s , and the second about a decade later .
#Text=It became a National Geopark in 2005 , a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2008 , and a UNESCO Global Geopark in 2015 .
#Text=Landscape
#Text=Sanqingshan is a mass of granite located on the Suzhou – Dexing Translithospheric Fracture Zone , an ancient plate boundary .
#Text=The rock spans over a billion years of geologic history .
#Text=Get in
#Text=The national park is about 150 km southeast of Jingdezhen and 50 km northeast of Shangrao .
#Text=From Yushan South ( high-speed ) railway station or Yushan Station take a bus or taxi to the Yushan bus terminal .
#Text=Regular buses from there to hotel villages at the south and east entrances cost 17¥ .
#Text=There are ropeways that will take you most of the way up the mountain from the and .
#Text=There is also a under the south ropeway , and trail access from in the north , but to reach the northern trailheads you 'll need to take a motorcycle taxi from the east entrance .
#Text=In particular , the northeast entrance at Yuling Temple is not accessible by vehicles larger than a motorcycle due to a gate several kilometres below the temple .
#Text=Fees and permits
#Text=Park admission costs 150¥ most of the year , or 130¥ in January , with discounts for children , students , and seniors .
#Text=A one-way trip up the ropeway is 70¥ , and descending is 55¥ .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Walk around on the paths .
#Text=If the stairs get too difficult , you can pay to get carried up in a basic sedan chair .
#Text=See
#Text=Sanqingshan has a large number of strangely-shaped rocks and twisted trees .
#Text=Many of the trees are ancient rhododendrons , so the mountain is covered in flowers in May .
#Text=The spectacular rock features are clustered mainly in the southern half of the mountaintop area .
#Text=It is possible to hike over and around a number of large rocks in the , and perhaps the most famous stone pillar resembles a .

#Text=There 's also an ancient Taoist temple , , toward the north end of the mountaintop , with a series of sights arranged around it and with various carvings and gates on the path up the mountain to its entrance .
#Text=This has been a place of Taoist worship for over 1500 years .
#Text=The old stone trail to the summit is not marked or maintained , but appears on most maps and can be climbed in under an hour .
#Text=There is a small shrine at the top .
#Text=Do
#Text=The main activities here are hiking and admiring the rocks and trees .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Food is available in various places on the mountain , but in all cases it is expensive compared to the base of the mountain .
#Text=The major hotels all have restaurants .
#Text=Away from the hotels , there are several small huts selling snacks , instant noodles , and fried chicken .
#Text=Lodging
#Text=There are a few hotels near the top of the south ropeway , and one near the top of the east ropeway .
#Text=Small villages of hotels and restaurants are available at the base of each .
#Text=There is also an halfway up the trail that parallels the south ropeway .
#Text=The hotels on the mountain tend to be expensive .
#Text=Camping
#Text=A number of places on top of the mountain offer camping , including near the , which is famous for sunrise , and in front of Sanqinggong .
#Text=Many of the hotels also offer tents .
#Text=If you do n't bring your own gear , you can rent a tent and bedding for 120-150¥ per night .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Stay on marked trails .
#Text=Be prepared for rapid weather changes and colder temperatures than at the base of the mountain .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Consider visiting the small old towns and terraced fields of Wuyuan , or the old villages of Hongcun and Xidi .
#Text=Huangshan is also nearby if you want to see more rocks and trees .
